--- title: "FAQ" engine: knitr ---
## Installation of R There are multiple ways to install R and RStudio for Windows, macOS and Linux. The easiest installation on Windows is a direct download from the website, while we can use command line interface on macOS and Linux. ### Installation on Windows To download R go to:
To download RStudio go to:
### Installation on macOS First, install [Homebrew](https://brew.sh), then run the following command lines in a terminal: ::: {.cell} ```{.bash .cell-code} brew install r brew install --cask rstudio ``` ::: ### Installation on Linux (Ubuntu 22.04) Run the following command lines in a terminal: ::: {.cell} ```{.bash .cell-code} sudo apt update sudo apt install r-base wget https://download1.rstudio.org/electron/jammy/amd64/rstudio-2023.06.0-421-amd64.deb sudo apt install -f ./rstudio-2023.03.0-386-amd64.deb rm ./rstudio-2023.03.0-386-amd64.deb ``` ::: Note that if you have another Unix distribution, the commands might be a bit different. You might also want to change the version of RStudio to be installed. ### Videos If you require additional assistance, feel free to ask me or refer to the instructional videos. - Installation of R in [video](https://player.vimeo.com/video/203516510) by RStudio Education. - Installation of RStudio in [video](https://player.vimeo.com/video/203516968) by RStudio Education.
